channel.title: VPS Question
channel.description:
Yes, the replies I am going to get will be very predictable "Use google" "Go to the website and ask!" And I understand you are still trying to help but, of course, I have tried that and could never get an answer to my SPECIFIC question.
My question is: I'm a customer of www.vpsland.com and I just bought a windows VPS on November 18th 2009. My server has started to become populated towards the end. And I would like to renew my subscription, but when I use "google" or go to the "website" the answer leads to losing all the files I originally had. Because so far, my VPS has WINRAR, Java, MY SOURCE (which is easily recoverable), and many other useful time consuming things. I just want to know how I can renew the subscription on the VPS I already have without losing my files and programs.

item.title: VPS Question
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Unhandled:

Don’t they just bill you monthly until you cancel? Like every other fucking host on the planet…

Read full topic

@bloodrayne wrote:

If they don’t, just contact customer support, I’m sure they’ll renew it.
